duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide Pantex Operations with tools, resources, and processes necessary to strategically plan, schedule, and optimize production operations.
Design and develop processes to support planning activities in collaboration with Systems Analysts and IS&S.
Maintain and document the processes used to support planning activities.
Assist in the integration and optimization of planning tools used to define demand for tooling, material, and production personnel across weapon programs.
Planning, organizing, coordinating, and controlling of programs in accordance with established policies, procedures, systems, and requirements.
Define tooling, material, and production personnel to ensure successful execution of work scope in collaboration with Production Management.
Provide support for the Pantex Move Right System.
Develop and maintain various key metrics for Pantex Operations in collaboration with Systems Analysts.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree: Minimum 2 years of relevant experience; typical experience ranging from 4 to 7 years OR Master's degree: Minimum 1 years of relevant experience; typical experience ranging from 4 to 7 years OR PhD
